Key Match Events: Bafana Bafana thrashed The Red Devils 5-0 courtesy of goals from Bathusi Aubaas, Lyle Foster, Iqraam Rayners and a brace by Teboho Mokoena.
Pre-Game Insights: Bafana Bafana is on the verge of securing their qualification for next year’s Africa Cup of Nations following their group K qualifiers’ match against Congo Brazzaville.
Bafana coach Hugo Broos has voiced out his concern about the synthetic pitch following their light training session where a light drizzle helped to cool down the scorching daytime temperatures.
Broos mentioned that they have had bad experiences with synthetic pitches in the past and hopes the pitch is good for them to play their best football.
The kick-off is set for 6pm and the 1996 AFCON champion will look for nothing but a victory in order to book their ticket to Morocco next year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The South African national football team arrived in Congo Brazzaville on Sunday afternoon as they prepare to battle it out against the same opponent with victory set to secure them qualification for next year’s continental showpiece in Morocco.
Currently, Bafana and Uganda are level on 7 points after three matches in Group K with Congo-Brazzaville on 3 points from their three matches while South Sudan are yet to register a victory.
